levelOne.name: Level One
levelOne.description: Reduces the extra damage from headshots by 30%

levelTwo.name: Level Two
levelTwo.description: Reduces the extra damage from headshots by 40%

levelThree.name: Level Three
levelThree.description: Reduces the extra damage from headshots by 50%

levelFour.name: Level Four
levelFour.description: Reduces the extra damage from headshots by 50%
levelFour.info: Reduces Tactical & Ultimate recharge time by 20%.

name: Body Shield
description: Prioritize finding one as soon as possible at the start of the game, regardless of its level. On intense firefights, it may be faster to switch to another body shield of the same or lower level instead of using shield cells or shield batteries, as all shields keep their health when dropped and all naturally spawned body shields always start with full health. Completing a finisher refills all shield health.

levelFour.name: Level Four
levelFour.info: Syringes and shield cells have improved effects. Syringes and shield cells replinish 50 points instead of 25.

name: Evo Shield
description: Evo shields gain strength when the wearer inflicts damage. If dropped or if the wearer dies, progress towards the next level is saved for the next wearer. Try to look for a used Evo Shield from other dead players so that you donâ€™t have to deal as much damage for the max level. Completing a Finisher refills all Shield health.

levelOne.name: Level One
levelOne.description: Absorbs 25 damage. Evolves to level two after dealing at least 75 damage to enemies.

levelTwo.name: Level Two
levelTwo.description: Absorbs 50 damage. Evolves to level three after dealing at least 150 damage to enemies.

levelThree.name: Level Three
levelThree.description: Absorbs 100 damage. Evolves to level four after dealing at least 400 damage to enemies.

levelFour.name: Level Five
levelFour.info: While shield cells still heal only 25 health with the Evo Shield equipped, shield batteries can heal 125 health, making them even more valuable. Although it may come to preference, sometimes a Legendary Body Shield may still be more valuable than a Level 5 Evo Shield due to it's Imoproved Minor Heal passive.

name: Knockdown Shield
description: Provides directional damage protection while knocked down. Reduces movement speed to 55%.

levelOne.name: Level One
levelOne.description: Shield absorbs a maximum of 200 damage.

levelTwo.name: Level Two
levelTwo.description: Shield absorbs a maximum of 450 damage.

levelThree.name: Level Three
levelThree.description: Shield absorbs a maximum of 750 damage.

levelFour.name: Level Five
levelFour.description: Shield absorbs a maximum of 750 damage.
levelFour.info: If a member of a squad has a Legendary knockdown shield equipped, the squad may stay active in the match until that player is killed. Takes 10 seconds for a player to fully revive with a Level Four knockdown shield. Once a revive has successfully been performed, the shield reverts to level four.

name: Backpack
description: Provides the play with additional storage slots (players are able to carry more items). It should be a priority to acquire a backpack as soon as possible. It gives you additional room to carry ammunition, consumables or attachments. Without a backpack equipped, a player has ten inventory slots.

levelOne.name: Level One
levelOne.description: player is able to carry 2 more items, for a total of 12.

levelTwo.name: Level Two
levelTwo.description: player is able to carry 4 more items, for a total of 14.

levelThree.name: Level Three
levelThree.description: player is able to carry 6 more items, for a total of 16.

levelFour.name: Level Five
levelFour.description: player is able to carry 6 more items, for a total of 16.
levelFour.info: If the player is carrying a level four backpack, when the player is revived, shields and health are restored by 50, resulting in 70 health and 50 shield.
